contentrichtext.text: {{About|the modern party|the 1930s party|Young Egypt Party (1933)}} {{Refimprove|date=December 2012}} {{Infobox political party |country = Egypt |party_name = Young Egypt Party |native_name = Hizb Misr El-Fatah |chairman = Mr.[[Abdul Hakim Abdul Majid Khalil]]{{Citation needed|date=December 2012}} |foundation = October 12, 1989<ref name="esis">{{cite web |url=http://www.sis.gov.eg/en/Story.aspx?sid=489 |title=Misr El-Fatah (Young Egypt) Party |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |publisher=Egypt State Information Service |accessdate=5 December 2012}}</ref> |dissolution = |headquarters = [[Cairo]] |ideology = [[Islamic socialism]], [[Socialism]], [[Liberal democracy]] |national = |colorcode = grey }} The '''Misr El-Fatah (Young Egypt) Party''' ({{lang-ar|حزب مصر الفتاة}} ''{{transl|ar|DIN|Ḥizb Miṣr al-Fatāh}}'') is an [[Egypt]]ian [[political party]]. == Platform == The Party platform calls for:<ref name=esis/> * Establishing a [[parliament]]ary/[[president]]ial ruling system. * Enhancing the Egyptian-[[Arab]] ties. * Achieving integration with [[Africa]]n countries. * Adopting non-alignment policies{{Clarify|date=February 2009}}. * Establishing the so-called [[socialist]] [[Islamic]] economic system and boosting the role of the private sector. == The Party & legislative elections== The Party fielded seven candidates to run for the 2000 legislative elections.<ref>{{citeweb|url=http://www.sis.gov.eg/En/Politics/Parties/Parties/041102000000000009.htm|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20081120081919/http://www.sis.gov.eg/En/Politics/Parties/Parties/041102000000000009.htm|archivedate=2008-11-20|title=Misr El-Fatah (Young Egypt) Party|work=Egypt State Information Service|accessdate=December 05, 2012}}</ref> == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.sis.gov.eg/En/Politics/Parties/Parties/041102000000000009.htm Misr El-Fatah (Young Egypt) New Party] {{Egyptian political parties}} [[Category:Political parties established in 1989]]
